required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Cholesterol Lowering Effect of an Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Combination Tablet Compared to Another Cholesterol Lowering Drug in Patients With High Cholesterol and With High Cardiovascular Risk (0653A-809)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Active-Controlled, Multicenter Study to Assess the LDL-C Lowering of Switching to a Combo Tab Ezetimibe/Simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg) Compared to Rosuvastatin 10 mg in Patients With Primary High Cholesterol and High Cardiovascular Risk Not Controlled With a Prior Statin Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ezetimibe/simvastatin versus rosuvastatin in participants with high cholesterol.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C) at Study Endpoint After Six Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Percent Change in LDL-C at study endpoint after six weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Percentage of Participants Achieving Designated Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C) Levels After 6 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who achieved a target LDL-C goal of < 100 mg/dL, of <70 mg/dL, and of <77 mg/dL at study endpoint after six weeks of treatment. The numerator is the number of participants in a treatment group who achieved a target LDL-C goal and the denominator is the total number of participants within that treatment group.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in total cholesterol at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Triglycerides.
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in triglycerides at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C)
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in HDL-C at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Non-High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (Non-HDL-C)
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in non HDL-C at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C)/High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C) Ratio
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in LDL-C/HDL-C ratio at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Total Cholesterol/High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C) Ratio
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in total cholesterol/HDL-C ratio at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in Apolipoprotein B
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in apolipoprotein (Apo) B at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

other_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in High-sensitivity C (Hs-C) Reactive Protein
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline in hs-C reactive protein at study endpoint after 6 weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.

intervention.description: ezetimibe/simvastatin 10/20mg. The treatment duration will be 6 weeks.
rosuvastatin 10mg. The treatment duration will be 6 weeks.
rosuvastatin 10mg Placebo. The treatment duration will be 6 weeks.
ezetimibe/simvastatin 10/20mg Placebo. The treatment duration will be 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant is currently taking a statin medication for the treatment of high cholesterol
- Participant has an LDL-C level that is greater than or equal to 100 mg/dl and less than or equal to 190 mg/dl
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are pregnant or nursing, or women who intend to become pregnant
- Participant has any condition, situation, or is currently taking any medication that might pose a risk to the participant or interfere with participation in the study

link.description: (MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information)
(Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site)

reference.citation: Farnier M, Averna M, Missault L, Vaverkova H, Viigimaa M, Massaad R, Vandormael K, Johnson-Levonas AO, Brudi P. Lipid-altering efficacy of ezetimibe/simvastatin 10/20 mg compared with rosuvastatin 10 mg in high-risk hypercholesterolaemic patients inadequately controlled with prior statin monotherapy - The IN-CROSS study. Int J Clin Pract. 2009 Apr;63(4):547-59. doi: 10.1111/j.1742-1241.2009.02022.x. Epub 2009 Feb 16.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase IV First Participant In: 31-Mar-2007; Last Participant Last Visit 11-Mar-2008 85 centers worldwide (EX US) Eligible participants include those on a stable dose of one of the following: rosuvastatin 5 mg; simvastatin 20 mg, 40 mg; atorvastatin 10, 20 mg; pravastatin 40 mg; fluvastatin 80 mg.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible participants were randomized at Visit 2 (Week 6) to either a combination tablet of ezetimibe/simvastatin (10 mg/20 mg) plus a matching placebo for rosuvastatin 10 mg (Group 1) or rosuvastatin 10 mg plus a matching placebo for the combination tablet (Group 2) for a 6-week treatment period.

group.title: Ezetemibe + Simvastatin
group.description: Ezetemibe 10 mg + Simvastatin 20 mg plus a matching placebo for rosuvastatin 10 mg QD (once a day) for 6 weeks

group.title: Rosuvastatin
group.description: Rosuvastatin 10 mg plus a matching placebo for the combination tablet QD (once a day) for 6 weeks

group.description: Ezetemibe 10 mg + Simvastatin 20 mg plus a matching placebo for rosuvastatin 10 mg QD (once a day) for 6 weeks

group.title: Rosuvastatin
group.description: Rosuvastatin 10 mg plus a matching placebo for the combination tablet QD (once a day) for 6 weeks

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C):High Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (HDL-C) ratio

outcome.title: Percent Change in Low Density Lipoprotein-Cholesterol (LDL-C) at Study Endpoint After Six Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Percent Change in LDL-C at study endpoint after six weeks of treatment is calculated as the difference between week 6 measure and baseline measure divided by baseline measure *100.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): The FAS population includes all randomized participants who took at least 1 dose of study medication and had a baseline (BL) value and at least one post BL value.

analysis.method_desc: ANOVA model based on Tukey’s normalized ranks with term for treatment, stratum, baseline (categorized based on quartiles) and center.
analysis.estimate_desc: The median difference between treatments is based on the Hodges-Lehmann estimates of shift with a corresponding distribution-free Confidence Interval (CI) based on Wilcoxon’s rank.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Vice President, Late Stage Development Group Leader
